docstr: `PERROR` â€” Print system error message ### Description Prints (on the C `stderr` stream) a newline-terminated error message corresponding to the last system error. This is prefixed by `STRING`, a colon and a space. See `perror(3)`. ### Syntax `CALL PERROR(STRING)` ### Arguments and of the default kind. ### Standard GNU extension ### Class Subroutine ### See also IERRNO
